1573145923_14g2gXnsZdEPShFJkGdh5W3eGXmKz.body: It wouldn't make much sense. On ZeroNet you are  supposed to put large files on IPFS. You could make a search engine, torrent databases are usually small in total size and you can always split it by time or tags.

> [merithtk](#comment_79_14g2gXnsZdEPShFJkGdh5W3eGXmKzqW6F8): I meant like writing a more native Bittorent Client for Zeronet, even if it functions just like ZeroUp [...]
A Bittorrent client is the software you have in your computer that downloads the files described in the .torrent file. It wouldn't make much sense to have a native client for zeronet, it would just be a normal client, written in JS, that runs in your browser.

> It would function kinda like that and ZeroUp, but it allows you to add external torrents
Just a database with search functionality is easy to implement.

EDIT: By that I mean a database to which people can upload their torrents.

1572640590_1NQXKFTnE1A2rWDm3ohhpUkQ3r9TR.body: digbt was a DHT crawler/search engine. You could run your own crawler and database or just look for something using those keywords. skytorrents.lol is one option.
